{{Use mdy dates|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Adam Ferrara | image = | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1966|2|2}} | birth_place = [[Queens]], [[New York (state)|New York]], [[United States]] | death_date = | death_place = | education = [[Marist College]] | medium = [[Stand up comedy|Stand-up]], [[film]], [[television]] | nationality = American | genre = | subject = | influences = [[Jackie Gleason]], [[Richard Pryor]], [[Chris Rush]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.vidiot.com/UPN/SS/bioFerrara.html |title=UPN: Social Studies Cast Bio - Adam Ferrara |publisher=Vidiot.com |date=January 15, 1997 |accessdate=November 28, 2010}}</ref> | website = {{URL|http://adamferrara.com/}} }} '''Adam Ferrara''' (born February 2, 1966) is an American [[actor]] and [[comedian]] known for playing the role of Chief "Needles" Nelson on the [[FX (TV channel)|FX]] series ''[[Rescue Me (U.S. TV series)|Rescue Me]]''. He was a co-host on the U.S. version of ''[[Top Gear (U.S. TV series)|Top Gear]]'' and played NYPD Sgt. Frank Verelli opposite [[Edie Falco]] on [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] series ''[[Nurse Jackie]]''. He also played Detective Tommy Manetti on the [[television]] series ''[[The Job (2001 TV series)|The Job]]''.
==Biography== Ferrara grew up in [[Huntington Station, New York]] in an [[Italian-American]] family. He is married to indie actress Alex Tyler, who is on the cover of his comedy DVD ''Funny as Hell''. She also plays the "Beautiful She Devil" in the special's introductory sketch.
===Career=== Ferrara has performed on [[Comedy Central Presents]] and has twice been nominated for the [[American Comedy Award]] for Best Male Stand-Up. Ferrara frequently performs stand-up at [[Caroline's]] and the [[Comedy Cellar]]. Ferrara also tours often, performing stand-up at the top clubs around the country.
He has performed stand-up several times on ''[[The Tonight Show]]'', the ''[[Late Show with David Letterman]]'', and [[Comedy Central]]. His stand up was featured in Comedy Central's animated series [[Shorties Watchin' Shorties]] in 2004.<ref>[http://thegrablegroup.com/speaker/adam-ferrara/ "Adam Ferrara Bio | The Grable Group"]</ref>
In 2009, Ferrara performed in an hour stand-up special which aired on [[Comedy Central]] entitled ''Funny As Hell'', and was released on [[DVD]] the same day. Ferrara appeared on [[The Tony Kornheiser Show]] on January 24, 2013. Subsequently, he made another appearance on [[The Tony Kornheiser Show]] on January 9, 2015 as co-host with [[Chris Cillizza]] who regularly co-hosts alongside Mr. Tony.
Ferrara co-hosted the American version of ''[[Top Gear (U.S. TV series)|Top Gear]]''.<ref name="urlAdam Ferrara in US Top Gear for History and BBC series - Monsters and Critics">{{cite web|url=http://www.monstersandcritics.com/smallscreen/news/article_1550045.php/Adam-Ferrara-in-US-Top-Gear-for-History-and-BBC-series |title=Adam Ferrara in US 'Top Gear 'for History and BBC series - Monsters and Critics |work= |accessdate=April 27, 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100424012219/http://www.monstersandcritics.com/smallscreen/news/article_1550045.php/Adam-Ferrara-in-US-Top-Gear-for-History-and-BBC-series |archivedate=April 24, 2010 |deadurl=yes }}</ref>
